titleStmt.title: A counter-blast to the Phanaticks, those prodigious catter-pillers, hatcht by the Jesuits, whose father is the devil, and god-father the pope. On their last insurrection against the life of his most sacred Majesty, Charles the second, King of Great Britaine, France and Ireland, defender of the faith, &c.
titleStmt.author: Duncombe, Giles.

titleStmt.title: A counter-blast to the Phanaticks, those prodigious catter-pillers, hatcht by the Jesuits, whose father is the devil, and god-father the pope. On their last insurrection against the life of his most sacred Majesty, Charles the second, King of Great Britaine, France and Ireland, defender of the faith, &c.
titleStmt.author: Duncombe, Giles.

notesStmt.note: Verse - "How? the Phanaticks sway? they stab the King?".
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
